Men and women have the same amount of genetic information EXCEPT when it comes to the X and Y chromosomes.

Women have 2 copies of X. This redundancy prevents many birth defects that men get.
Men have only 1 X but also have 1 Y chromosome. 
So, men actually have additional information that women lack.

Twenty years ago, scientists identified and located 30,000 human genes.  The remaining 8 percent is not necessarily new ‚Äúgenes‚Äù in the sense that they code for proteins.  These are highly repeated DNA sequences that may serve regulatory or structural functions in the genome.  This is an important milestone even if we still don‚Äôt understand what most of the genome does yet.  It‚Äôs like a map of the universe that will guide our future explorations.

Why do people and all living things die? If evolution pushes for "survival of the fittest", with survival as the goal, why aren't there some immortal or near-immortal self-repairing organisms?

Answer: any immortal organism would never have evolved in the first place. Death and turnover in population is necessary for evolution to happen.  Any species that stagnates is doomed.
